text: <@U0265G76F>: <@U0260V1BX> <@U026PLK4S> unfortunately Angela has accepted another offer and is off the table for the design internship
gah
yea, sucks
:disappointed:
i feel pretty "meh" about all of the other candidates...
well hit up some folks and drum up some interest! :simple_smile:
i've reached out to trent and phillip who will funnel some folks our way
but i'd love more help
I think we need to re-focus on potential. Both Phillip and Trent we're probably also "pretty meh" at first glance...
myself as well

I'm certainly open to meeting the others, I just want to make sure we find someone who is interested in UX/interaction design and isnt just applying here because we're another design studio. Interviews will tell.
just seeing this. I'll shake as many trees as possible. U of O was already shaken a few times (and typically doesn't have many folks), I'll write to PSU today, as well as this guy in Austin
I just don't see a ton of students with lots of UX experience. They're interns.
I dont mean UX experience, I mean UX interest
which to me is signified by an awareness of, and respect to audience and context for their designs
Right. My point is that usually, the folks you're describing, aren't the best designers. Take Austin for example. I just don't it's fair to expect an intern to have both.
that's why I'm sad about Angela. She had both.
i'll kick up some dust at Art Center - as I think they go broad and really harsh on students
where she was from
looking thru the art center intro email, they have all students posting material here
<http://network.artcenter.edu/>

attachments.text: The Art Center Gallery on Behance &mdash; an exclusive online network &mdash; showcases the work of Art Center students, faculty, alumni and staff. The Gallery provides a new, online platform to showcase their work, network with potential employers, seek new opportunities to collaborate and connect with the larger Art Center community.
attachments.fallback: The Art Center Gallery on Behance &mdash; an exclusive online network &mdash; showcases the work of Art Center students, faculty, alumni and staff. The Gallery provides a new, online platform to showcase their work, network with potential employers, seek new opportunities to collaborate and connect with the larger Art Center community.

text: i'll try to take a look through and see if anybody sticks out
awesome thanks
yea i'm not opposed to us reaching out to individuals at all
Oh <@U026103R3> i finally read Bayard's cover letter and he's not worth our time
ha, ok
i will make my phone call with him approv 5 minutes long
lol
sorry
dont be sorry!
<!channel>: got another design candidate in - ryan dutch
check him out, let me know thoughts on trello

Also, heard back from Kate on renewed push: "awesome! we announced it at show & tell yesterday and I sent it out in our weekly newsletter on sunday and posted it on the blog too. I am going to send this to Thom Hines (our interaction professor) to see who his stand outs are right now.

THANKS DAVID!"
Love the idea of talking to Thom.
awesome, thanks guys!
trent also hit up a professor who said he knew of at least one person if not more that plan to apply
